# .gitignore Guide
## Understanding Your Unity Project's Git Configuration

This guide explains the `.gitignore` file and what gets committed to Git.

---

## âœ… What's Ignored (Not Committed)

### Unity Generated Folders
```
Library/          - Unity's cache (regenerated)
Temp/             - Temporary build files
Obj/              - Compiled objects
Build/            - Build output
Builds/           - Build output (alternate)
Logs/             - Unity logs
UserSettings/     - Per-user preferences
MemoryCaptures/   - Memory profiling data
```

**Why ignored?** These are regenerated by Unity and contain machine-specific data.

### IDE/Editor Files
```
.vs/              - Visual Studio settings
.vscode/          - VS Code settings
.idea/            - JetBrains Rider settings
*.csproj          - Generated project files
*.sln             - Generated solution files
*.user            - User-specific settings
```

**Why ignored?** Auto-generated and user-specific.

### Operating System Files
```
.DS_Store         - macOS metadata
Thumbs.db         - Windows thumbnails
Desktop.ini       - Windows folder settings
```

**Why ignored?** OS-specific junk files.

### Third-Party Assets
```
Assets/CodeMonkey/    - CodeMonkey Toolkit (your request)
Assets/Codemonkey/    - Case variation
CodeMonkey/           - Root level variation
Codemonkey/           - Root level case variation
```

**Why ignored?** Third-party asset pack that can be re-downloaded.

---

## ğŸ“¦ What's Committed (Tracked by Git)

### Essential Project Files
```
Assets/               - Your game assets
  â”œâ”€â”€ Scenes/         - Unity scenes
  â”œâ”€â”€ Scripts/        - Your C# scripts
  â”œâ”€â”€ Prefabs/        - Reusable objects
  â”œâ”€â”€ Materials/      - Materials
  â”œâ”€â”€ Shaders/        - Shader files
  â”œâ”€â”€ Audio/          - Audio files
  â””â”€â”€ *.meta          - Unity metadata files
```

### Project Configuration
```
ProjectSettings/      - Unity project settings
  â”œâ”€â”€ EditorBuildSettings.asset
  â”œâ”€â”€ ProjectSettings.asset
  â”œâ”€â”€ QualitySettings.asset
  â””â”€â”€ ... (all settings)
```

### Package Management
```
Packages/
  â”œâ”€â”€ manifest.json         - Package dependencies
  â””â”€â”€ packages-lock.json    - Locked versions
```

### Documentation
```
README.md
CHANGELOG.md
Docs/
*.md files
```

---

## ğŸ” Testing Your .gitignore

### Check if a file/folder is ignored:
```powershell
# Test specific paths
git check-ignore -v Library/
git check-ignore -v Assets/CodeMonkey/
git check-ignore -v .vs/

# Output shows: [line in .gitignore]:[pattern] [path]
# Example: .gitignore:9:[Ll]ibrary/ Library/
```

### See what would be committed:
```powershell
# Show untracked files
git status

# Show what's staged
git status --short
```

### See what's currently ignored:
```powershell
# List all ignored files (can be long!)
git status --ignored --short
```

---

## ğŸ› ï¸ Common Scenarios

### Accidentally Committed Generated Files?

If you committed Library/ or Temp/ before adding .gitignore:

```powershell
# Remove from Git (but keep locally)
git rm -r --cached Library/
git rm -r --cached Temp/
git rm -r --cached Logs/

# Commit the removal
git commit -m "Remove generated Unity folders from tracking"
```

### Want to Track a Normally Ignored File?

Use `git add -f` to force add:
```powershell
git add -f path/to/file
```

### Need to Ignore Additional Folders?

Add to `.gitignore`:
```
# Your custom ignores
[Aa]ssets/MyThirdPartyAsset/
[Aa]ssets/TestFolder/
```

---

## ğŸ“‹ .gitignore Pattern Syntax

### Basic Patterns
```
Library/          - Exact folder name
*.csproj          - All files ending in .csproj
.vs/              - Hidden folder
```

### Case-Insensitive Patterns
```
[Ll]ibrary/       - Matches: Library/, library/
[Aa]ssets/        - Matches: Assets/, assets/
[Bb]uild/         - Matches: Build/, build/
```

### Wildcards
```
*.log             - All .log files
temp*             - Files starting with temp
build/*/          - All subdirectories in build/
```

### Path Patterns
```
/Logs/            - Only root-level Logs/
**/Logs/          - Logs/ anywhere in tree
Assets/**/*.meta  - All .meta files under Assets/
```

---

## âš ï¸ Important Notes

### Meta Files
Unity creates `.meta` files for every asset. These MUST be committed:
- âœ… `.meta` files are tracked (not in .gitignore)
- âŒ Don't add `*.meta` to .gitignore
- ğŸ”´ Missing .meta files cause GUID conflicts

### Asset Store Tools
```
[Aa]ssets/AssetStoreTools*
```
This is included but commented out in standard Unity .gitignore.
We keep it active to avoid committing Asset Store helper files.

### CodeMonkey Folder
Per your request, these patterns ignore CodeMonkey:
```
[Aa]ssets/CodeMonkey/
[Aa]ssets/Codemonkey/
CodeMonkey/
Codemonkey/
```

All case variations are covered.

---

## ğŸ”„ Syncing With Collaborators

### First Clone
When someone clones your repo:
```powershell
git clone [repository-url]
cd 2D-Sandbox
# Unity will regenerate Library/, Temp/, etc.
```

### Pulling Updates
```powershell
git pull
# Unity auto-detects changes and re-imports
```

### Common Issues

**"GUID Conflicts"**
- Cause: Missing .meta files
- Solution: Ensure .meta files are committed

**"Everything Shows as Changed"**
- Cause: Line ending differences (Windows vs Mac)
- Solution: Add `.gitattributes` file with Unity rules

**"Unity Won't Open Project"**
- Cause: Missing ProjectSettings/
- Solution: Verify ProjectSettings/ is committed

---

## ğŸ“Š Repository Size Impact

### Without .gitignore:
```
Library/     - 500 MB - 2 GB
Temp/        - 100 MB - 500 MB
Logs/        - 10 MB - 100 MB
Total: 600 MB - 2.6 GB âŒ
```

### With .gitignore:
```
Assets/      - 50 MB - 200 MB
ProjectSettings/ - 1 MB
Packages/    - < 1 MB
Total: 50 MB - 200 MB âœ…
```

**Savings: 90-95% smaller repository!**

---

## âœ… Best Practices

1. **Commit .gitignore first** - Before any other files
2. **Never force-add generated files** - Don't use `git add -f` on Library/
3. **Keep .meta files** - Essential for Unity
4. **Test before pushing** - Use `git status` to verify
5. **Document custom ignores** - Comment why you ignore specific folders

---

## ğŸš€ Quick Checklist

Before pushing to GitHub:

- [ ] `.gitignore` exists at project root
- [ ] Library/ folder not in Git
- [ ] Temp/ folder not in Git
- [ ] .vs/ or .idea/ folders not in Git
- [ ] CodeMonkey/ folder not in Git
- [ ] All .meta files ARE in Git
- [ ] ProjectSettings/ IS in Git
- [ ] Assets/ IS in Git
- [ ] Repository size reasonable (< 200 MB)

### Check with:
```powershell
git status --short --ignored | Select-String "Library|Temp|\.vs|CodeMonkey"
```

If these appear with `!!` prefix, they're correctly ignored.

## ğŸ†˜ Troubleshooting

### Problem: Files showing as changed but I didn't modify them

**Solution:**
```powershell
# Check if it's line endings
git config core.autocrlf true

# Or add .gitattributes file
```

### Problem: Can't push - repo too large

**Solution:**
```powershell
# Check what's taking space
git count-objects -vH

# Find large files
git rev-list --objects --all | grep "$(git verify-pack -v .git/objects/pack/*.idx | sort -k 3 -n | tail -10 | awk '{print$1}')"
```

### Problem: CodeMonkey folder still shows in Git

**Solution:**
```powershell
# Remove from tracking
git rm -r --cached Assets/CodeMonkey/
git commit -m "Remove CodeMonkey from tracking"
```

---

## ğŸ“ Your Current Configuration

**Location:** `.gitignore` in project root

**Key Ignores:**
- âœ… All Unity generated folders
- âœ… IDE files (.vs/, .idea/, .vscode/)
- âœ… OS files (.DS_Store, Thumbs.db)
- âœ… CodeMonkey folder (all variations)
- âœ… Build outputs
- âœ… Solution/project files

**Status:** âœ… **Production-ready and GitHub-compatible**
